citeinfo.title: The StreamCat Dataset: Accumulated Attributes for NHDPlusV2 (Version 2.1) Catchments for the Conterminous United States: National Atmospheric Deposition Program National Trends Network - Nitrogen Deposition

pubinfo.publish: US EPA Office of Research & Development (ORD) - National Health and Environmental Effects Research Laboratory (NHEERL)

descript.abstract:
This dataset represents deposition estimates of nutrients within individual local NHDPlusV2 catchments and upstream, contributing watersheds based on the National Atmospheric Deposition Program (See Supplementary Info for Glossary of Terms).
The National Trends Network provides long-term records of precipitation chemistry across the United States. Individual rasters describe ammonium, nitrate, inorganic nitrogen, and average sulfur/nitrogen deposition per year. See Source Info for links to NADP.
The nitrogen and sulfur characteristics (kg N/ha/yr) were summarized to produce local catchment-level and watershed-level metrics as a continuous data type (see Data Structure and Attribute Information for a description).
descript.purpose: These data were created in support of the US EPAâ€™s National Aquatic Resource Survey (NARS) and Safe and Sustainable Waters Resources (SSWR) Programs. However, these watershed summaries of landscape data have broad applicability for hydrological, geomorphic, or ecological modeling, management, and restoration. For details on EPA NARS and SSWR Programs see http://water.epa.gov/type/watersheds/monitoring/aquaticsurvey_index.cfm and http://www.epa.gov/research/progressreport/water.htm
descript.supplinf:
All code and scripts used to produce these data were written in the python or R programming languages and are freely available at: ftp://newftp.epa.gov/EPADataCommons/ORD/NHDPlusLandscapeAttributes/StreamCat/Documentation/Code/ or https://github.com/USEPA/StreamCat
Glossary of Terms
Stream Segment: NHD line describing a section of contiguous stream or river between upstream and downstream tributaries (as depicted in USGS topographic quadrangles), except where the segment is a headwater or terminal stream (e.g., an outlet to the ocean).
Catchment (Cat): The portion of the landscape where surface flow drains directly to an NHD stream segment, excluding any upstream contributions.
Watershed (Ws): The set of hydrologically-connected catchments, consisting of all upstream catchments that contribute flow to any local catchment.
COMID: Unique identifier for each stream segment, and associated catchment, in NHDPlusV2. Watershed metrics describe entire area of all catchments that accumulate to the specific catchment based on the NHD PlusFlow table.
Riparian Buffer (RipBuf): Spatial buffer of 100-m that was added to NHDPlusV2 stream network and NLCD water pixels. The buffers were used to spatially constrain calculations for some landscape metrics to within 100 meters of the riparian area.
Landscape Layer: Any geospatial layer from which we derived statistical summaries for both local catchments and watersheds. These landscape layers were comprised of several GIS formats, including vector (points, lines, or polygons) and raster.

idinfo.useconst: None. procstep.procdesc: Dataset downloaded from https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas/ Data source, date, units and resolution were recorded in a project tracking spreadsheet and verified. ftp://newftp.epa.gov/EPADataCommons/ORD/NHDPlusLandscapeAttributes/StreamCat/Documentation/DataDictionary.html
Projection of dataset verified as USGS Albers Equal Area Conic and projected if necessary

Performed a visual inspection of dataset for gaps, edges other anomalous features. Verified how no-data values were represented and recoded values as no-data where appropriate (for instance, if no-data locations represented by 0's or -9999, these were converted to no-data values). Data manipulation documented in Pre-Processing script (StreamCat_PreProcessing.py)

Ran zonal statistics python script (StreamCat.py) to calculate zonal statistics for all NHDPlusV2 catchments in each NHDPlusV2 Vector Processing Unit (VPU). The ArcGIS spatial analyst tool-Zonal Statistics As Table was used to summarize statistics. Zonal statistics are returned as the COUNT and SUM of cells from the value raster in each catchment. Calculated the percent of each catchment that had coverage by a given landscape raster (i.e. was not null). These results are accumulated using the NHDPlusV2 flow table to summarize upstream catchment values and complete watershed values for the metric.

Clean and standardize results of zonal statistics table from accumulation script / process (makeFinalTables.py). Clean up consisted of calculating mean value of metric per zone, renaming and sorting zonal statistics fields, and writing zonal results to .csv file.

citeinfo.origin: United States Geological Survey (USGS) and US EPA
citeinfo.title: National Hydrography Dataset Plus

enttyp.enttypd: Deposition estimates of total sulfur and nitrogen deposition for use in critical loads and other ecological assessments.

attr.attrdef: Unique ID label to each catchment in NHDPlusV2
Area of local catchment measured in square kilometers.
% of the catchment that is covered by the landscape raster.
Area of the local catchment and accumulated upstream catchments composing the entire watershed (Ws) measured in square kilometers.
% of the watershed that is covered by the landscape raster.
Annual average of precipitation-weighted mean deposition for ammonium ion concentration for year, 2008, within the local catchment (Cat)
Annual average of precipitation-weighted mean deposition for nitrate ion concentration for year, 2008, within the local catchment (Cat)
Annual average of precipitation-weighted mean wet deposition for inorganic nitrogen concentration from nitrate and ammonium for year, 2008 within the local catchment (Cat)
Annual average of precipitation-weighted mean deposition for average sulfur and nitrogen concentration for year, 2008, within the local catchment (Cat)
Annual average of precipitation-weighted mean deposition for ammonium ion concentration for year, 2008, within the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Annual average of precipitation-weighted mean deposition for nitrate ion concentration for year, 2008, within the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Annual average of precipitation-weighted mean wet deposition for inorganic nitrogen concentration from nitrate and ammonium for year, 2008 within the total upstream watershed (Ws)
Annual average of precipitation-weighted mean deposition for average sulfur and nitrogen concentration for year, 2008, within the total upstream watershed (Ws)
